name: Sturdevant, Appellant, v. Dalton Sewer Authority

judges: Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Eagbn, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy and Barbieri, JJ.
parties: Sturdevant, Appellant, v. Dalton Sewer Authority.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
Decree of April 30, 1971 vacated. The matter is remanded to the court below with instructions to immediately proceed to permit appellee to file preliminary objections to the complaint, if it so desires, or, in lieu thereof, an answer on the merits, in which latter event upon filing of such answer, an evidentiary hearing should be held forthwith and the matter determined with expedition.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: John J. Dunn, and Shearer, Mette & Hoerner, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Sturdevant, Appellant, v. Dalton Sewer Authority.
Submitted July 19, 1971.
Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Eagbn, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy and Barbieri, JJ.
William Zacharellis, for appellant.
John J. Dunn, and Shearer, Mette & Hoerner, for appellee.
August 10, 1971:
